meanings.definition: Farther away in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The campsite was remoter than we expected, making it difficult to reach.
meanings.sent2: She gazed at the stars, wondering how much remoter they were compared to the moon.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a picnic on Mars seemed remoter than finding a unicorn.
meanings.sent4: As the days passed, his childhood memories grew remoter, like fading echoes in a vast canyon.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood on the remoter side of the island, shrouded in mystery and time.

meanings.definition: More distant in relationship or connection.
meanings.sent1: The remoter relatives only visited during major holidays.
meanings.sent2: Their friendship grew stronger despite having remoter backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The idea of being related to a famous celebrity felt remoter than winning the lottery.
meanings.sent4: The remoter islands in the archipelago were like hidden gems waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: His remoter ancestors were said to have been explorers, venturing into unknown lands.
